results.title: Public hangings. Series 2. Ep. 10
results.brief_description: Public hangings is a local television program on the arts produced for broadcast on community television (channel 31) in Melbourne, Australia from 2002. Enjoying a cult following, the program (now in its second series) produced by Irish art critic and London gallery director, Andrew MacKenzie along with co-presenter Lena Corner, roams the streets of Melbourne in search of opening nights and visual vox pops. The program’s style makes the avant garde accessible and provides an insight into a vibrant underground city culture. In this episode Andrew MacKenzie interviews Juliana Enberg, director of the Australian Centre for Contemporary Art (ACCA) at the opening of it’s new building at Southbank and inaugural exhibition by Susan Norrie ‘A History of Happiness’. The American artist Steve Keene exhibits his latest work at Linden gallery with the claim as being ‘the most prolific artist in America’. His work pokes fun at the age of “mechanical” reproduction and technologically driven work. Sandra Bridie, artist in residence at Tower Studio discusses her project ‘6 Contextual Modules’ and discusses her ongoing solo practise where Bridie presents herself as a multiple of fictional artists. Dominic Lococo discusses F4, a new multi-media space. Screen Talk: Brendan Lee discusses “Projekt”, the first quarterly journal in VHS format and presents excerpts including ‘Test’ by Sanja Pahoki, ‘The Bong Relay Business’ by TV Moore and ‘Container’ by Stephen Honeggar and Anthony Hunt.

results.title: Banduk
results.creator_credit: Di Drew, Penelope Spence and National Nine Network
results.brief_description: Banduk, a young Aboriginal girl, and her friends discover that the “friendly” proprietors of an ice-cream van are smuggling native animals, including the sacred red-collared parakeet, out of Australia. This delightful story was filmed on location in Arnhem Land.

results.title: Birthday boy
results.creator_credit: Sejong Park, Andrew Gregory and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Korea 1951 - little Manuk is playing on the streets of his village and dreaming of life at the front where his father is a soldier. He returns home to find a parcel on the doorstep and, thinking it is a birthday present, he opens it. But its contents will change his life.

results.title: Press any button
results.creator_credit: Anna Fraser, Tim Kreibig and AFTRS
results.brief_description: For Sophie, every day is full of choices… Independent person? Mother? Consumer? Woman? What will it be today? Features Lucy Bell as the woman and Lily Fraser as the little girl.

results.title: Car park
results.creator_credit: Darcy Yuille, Leesa Kahn and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Welcome to the world of Car Park - a multi-layered absurdist satire on the nature of relationships, communication and finding a parking space when you need one.

results.title: Placement
results.creator_credit: Bill Chen, Sarah Warner and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Sometime in the future, Max lives with his only daughter, Ruby, in an apartment complex where he spends all his time working. But his life is shattered when Ruby chases her balloon off the edge and falls to the street below.
He is offered the chance to clone her and puts his strong religious beliefs aside in order to have his daughter back, but the new Ruby is not the same.

results.creator_credit: Peter Carstairs, Sarah Warner and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A jaded single mum and the son who carries her into his world of imagination. Sometimes it takes more than a bath to change the way we think.

results.title: Pending
results.creator_credit: Anna Tow, Paola Garofali and AFTRS
results.brief_description: In this fantasy animation, Jasmine flees her war-torn country for the safety of the towering City of Anchors. But between her traumatic past and her hopes for a new life, Jasmine must first face a heartless Immigration Department bureaucrat and persuade him to let her stay. Original Format 35 mm/colour.

results.title: The Other son
results.creator_credit: Heng Tang, Rachel Roberts and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Vera is the meticulous wife, mother and reigning matriarch of her palatial home. She manages her domestic domain with digital clockwork precision. It is 7pm and dinner time. Her dutiful husband and beautiful son take their designated places at the table. However, the tranquillity is interrupted by the sudden appearance of an intruder threatening to shatter Vera’s utopia. Original format 35mm/colour.

Original format 35mm/colour.

results.title: The Watchers
results.creator_credit: Steven McGregor, Joe Weatherstone, AFTRS and Cath Moore
results.brief_description: In a world where all our desires are monitored, a teenage boy is inspired to cross the line. But The Watchers are out and they show him where his actions may lead. Cast: Wayne Pygram, Dane Sheddon, Nathaniel Dean, Wayne Blair. 35mm live action footage with digital effects created on SGI, Mac and PC. Original format 35 mm/colour.
